title: Primes and polygonal numbers
abstract:
For all integers $r,s>2$, there are infinitely many primes which can be
written as the sum of an $r$-gonal number and an $s$-gonal number. In general,
any linear combination of an $r$-gonal number and an $s$-gonal number with
coprime positive integer coefficients produces infinitely many primes. However,
unless $r=s=4$, such primes can not be described by finitely many congruences.
